text.__SUMMARY__: Dendrobium plicatile is an orchid species of Asia. It was formerly treated as Flickingeria fimbriata in the (no longer accepted) genus Flickingeria.
text.Distribution:
The orchid is native to Southeast Asia, the Himalayas, Malesia, and other regions.
It is found in: Borneo, Cambodia, China South-Central, China Southeast, Hainan, Himalayas East, India ( Assam), Jawa, Laos, Lesser Sunda Islands, Malaya, Nepal, Nicobar Islands, Philippines, Sulawesi, Sumatera, Thailand, Vietnam.
text.Description: Medicinal plantThe plant reportedly has the Hepatoprotection properties, the ability to prevent damage to the liver.From the stems, three phenanthrenes can be isolated, named plicatol A, B and C.The plant also contains the norditerpenoids named flickinflimilins A and B and steroids.
